answers.author: Jared Cobb
answers.text:
There are a number of systems commonly used by local governments. To start, I would look into the systems offered by Harris (harrislocalgov.com), Sage (na.sage.com) and Tyler Technologies (tylertech.com). Each offers several solutions tailored to your specific needs and budget.

answers.author: Gloria Osborn
answers.text:
We are a city of 32,000 and currently use Springbrook (since 2007). We are currently on version 6 and will be migrating to version 7 this summer and adding 5 additional modules in the near future.   When we considered the purchase of new software in 2007 we also took into consideration the annual maintenance fees and maintenance support.

author: Andrew Marquardt
text: I work for  a city of 8600 people with a $15 million budget and we are looking at the possibility of replacing our current accounting software, Springbrook V7, with another program that is more streamlined and less labor intensive.  I am wondering what other cities are using for their accounting software.
title: City-wide Accounting Systems?
